<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

<target_code>
Here is the code of mutex_thread:
```c
static void *mutex_thread(void *arg)
{
	metal_mutex_t *l = arg;
	int i;

	for (i = 0; i < mutex_test_count; i++) {
		metal_mutex_acquire(l);
		usleep(1);
		metal_mutex_release(l);
	}

	return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function mutex_thread:
static const int mutex_test_count = 1000
...
static void *producer_thread(void *arg)
{
	(void)arg;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&lock);
	while (counter == COUNTER_MAX)
		metal_condition_wait(&nfull_condv, &lock);
	counter++;
	metal_condition_signal(&nempty_condv);
	metal_mutex_release(&lock);

	return NULL;
}
...
static void *consumer_thread(void *arg)
{
	(void)arg;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&lock);
	while (!counter)
		metal_condition_wait(&nempty_condv, &lock);
	counter--;
	metal_condition_signal(&nfull_condv);
	metal_mutex_release(&lock);

	return NULL;
}
</additional code>

explanation:
No controlling expressions that are invariant were found in the provided code. Rationale by fragment: 
- mutex_thread: for (i = 0; i < mutex_test_count; i++) — the loop control depends on the loop variable i which is modified each iteration; although mutex_test_count is a compile-time constant, the controlling expression is not invariant. 
- producer_thread: while (counter == COUNTER_MAX) metal_condition_wait(...); — the condition depends on the variable counter which is modified by threads; it is not an invariant. The wait/release semantics indicate the loop is intended to block until counter changes. 
- consumer_thread: while (!counter) metal_condition_wait(...); — similarly depends on counter and is not invariant. 
No other loops or controlling expressions were present in the supplied code. The allowed exceptions (infinite loops using invariant expressions and the do-while constant-false exception) do not apply here.
